intro: Acourtia gracilis, commonly known as the slender acourtia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils in arid and semi-arid environments. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, yellow to orange flowers. Acourtia gracilis is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed areas.
